misuse: CWE-327: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm.
description: The use of a password-based encryption (PBE) with a low iteration count (11010) and a short key length (16) is considered insecure.
recommendation: Use a higher iteration count and a longer key length to increase the security of the PBE.

misuse: CWE-757: Selection of Less-Secure Algorithm During Negotiation.
description: The use of a short key length (16) for the PBE is considered insecure.
recommendation: Use a longer key length (e.g. 256) for the PBE to increase the security.
